title: Duncryne Hill Walking Route

images.title: paul birrell / Loch Lomond from Duncryne Hill
images.caption: Loch Lomond from Duncryne Hill. The hill is a volcanic plug near to Gartocharn south of Loch Lomond and offers these fantastic views over the water.

images.title: Stanley Howe, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View over Gartocharn to Duncryne Hill, West Dunbartonshire

images.title: Stephen Sweeney / View to Gartocharn from summit of Duncryne
images.caption: View to Gartocharn from the hill summit

description: This short climb takes you to the top of Duncryne hill near Gartocharn in the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park. The hill is known as the 'Dumpling ' and stands at a modest height of 465 ft (142 m) giving wonderful views towards Loch Lomond. You can park by the roadside on Duncryne Road where you will find a gate and a good footpath leading through woodland to the hill. You follow the path to the hill summit where you will find a triangulation point. From here there are fabulous views over the Loch, its islands and the surrounding mountains of Ben Lomond and The Cobbler .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs Walks page.

display_address: Duncryne Road, Gartocharn, West Dunbartonshire, Alba / Scotland, G83 8RZ, United Kingdom
